stanford.androidlib

Class SimpleProgressDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Dialog
      • android.app.AlertDialog
        • android.app.ProgressDialog
          • stanford.androidlib.SimpleProgressDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DialogInterface, KeyEvent.Callback, View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, Window.Callback

    public class SimpleProgressDialog
extends ProgressDialog
    A version of ProgressDialog that auto-closes when it reaches 100% progress.

    • Method Detail

      • incrementProgressBy

        public void incrementProgressBy(int amount)
        Increases progress by the given amount. If it reaches its max amount, the dialog closes.
        Overrides:
        incrementProgressBy in class ProgressDialog

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Returns true if the dialog's progress has reached its max. Always returns false for indeterminate dialogs because by nature we do not know when they are done.

      • isInProgress

        public boolean isInProgress()
        Returns true if the dialog's progress has not yet reached its max, or true if the dialog is indeterminate.

      • setProgress

        public void setProgress(int value)
        Sets progress to the given value. If it reaches its max amount, the dialog closes.
        Overrides:
        setProgress in class ProgressDialog

      • setProgress

        public void setProgress(int value,
                        boolean closeIfFinished)
        Sets progress to the given value. If closeIfFinished is true and it reaches its max amount, the dialog closes.
